poem:
### Breathless Descent

Andrzej whispers to the wind,  
a snowbound sonnet of will,  
where footsteps feather  
at the edge of earth's lung,  
crisp air slicing the throat  
of the world's spine.  
Gravity sighs,  
while skiing Everest's breathless crown—  
no bottled breath, just his own pulse,  
a whispered vow  
to the mountain's silent song.
